review_title: If you like going to class and making some cash, this might be for you
pros: Get a front row seat during lectures. Get paid to go to class. The media services folks are all great to work with and very accommodating. Only work every other week.
cons: None of the faculty at the school really think you for the school, including those that work at mandatory sessions of group quizzes. They would want to say you were late and potentially mark a professionalism violation just because you were late from stopping the recording and uploading it in the classroom.

review_title: A very comfortable place to work.
pros: WVSOM is a very supportive place to work — "family" is not an exaggeration. There can be a lot of leeway to do your job as you see fit, as long as you get the work done.
cons: WVSOM, as an organization, can be very set in its ways — change happens very slowly, if it happens at all.
